ticket.title: Eliminate Regexp test warnings
ticket.original-body:
Subvert 'ambiguous first argument' warnings from RegexpExtAccessTests#test_multiline by using assert_equal.
Ruby warns when a Regexp literal with a modifier option is used as an argument to a method without parens.
@@@ $ ruby -vwe "puts //m" ruby 1.8.7 (2008-08-11 patchlevel 72) [i686-darwin9] -e:1: warning: ambiguous first argument; put parentheses or even spaces (?m-ix:) $ ruby -vwe "puts(//m)" ruby 1.8.7 (2008-08-11 patchlevel 72) [i686-darwin9] (?m-ix:) @@@
Could also have parenthesized assert(), but that looks ugly.
ticket.latest-body:
Subvert 'ambiguous first argument' warnings from RegexpExtAccessTests#test_multiline by using assert_equal.
Ruby warns when a Regexp literal with a modifier option is used as an argument to a method without parens.
@@@ $ ruby -vwe "puts //m" ruby 1.8.7 (2008-08-11 patchlevel 72) [i686-darwin9] -e:1: warning: ambiguous first argument; put parentheses or even spaces (?m-ix:) $ ruby -vwe "puts(//m)" ruby 1.8.7 (2008-08-11 patchlevel 72) [i686-darwin9] (?m-ix:) @@@
Could also have parenthesized assert(), but that looks ugly.
ticket.original-body-html:
Subvert 'ambiguous first argument' warnings from RegexpExtAccessTests#test_multiline by using assert_equal.

Ruby warns when a Regexp literal with a modifier option is used as an argument to a method without parens.


$ ruby -vwe "puts //m"
ruby 1.8.7 (2008-08-11 patchlevel 72) [i686-darwin9]
-e:1: warning: ambiguous first argument; put parentheses or even spaces
(?m-ix:)
$ ruby -vwe "puts(//m)"
ruby 1.8.7 (2008-08-11 patchlevel 72) [i686-darwin9]
(?m-ix:)

Could also have parenthesized assert(), but that looks ugly.

Could also have parenthesized assert(), but that looks ugly.
